title: Kenya to roll out HIV prevention shots in March
description:
Kenya will begin rolling out groundbreaking HIV prevention shots, lenacapavir, in March across 15 priority counties to combat the spread of the virus.

Read More: https://punchng.com/kenya-to-roll-out-hiv-prevention-shots-in-march/

title: Ucraina, țară aflată în război, are o rată de vaccinare mai mare decât România. Epidemiolog: „Ar trebui să ne dea de gândit”
description: Ucraina, aflată în război, are în prezent o rată de vaccinare mai mare decât România, a declarat dr. Mihai Negrea, medic specialist epidemiolog în cadrul Spitalul Județean de Urgență Târgu Mureș.

title: Ucraina, în stare de război, are rată de vaccinare mai mare decât România
description: Rata de vaccinare a scăzut semnificativ în ultimii ani, pentru că dezinformarea medicală este la cote alarmante pe reţelele de socializare şi nu doar. Ucraina, o țară aflată în plin război, are o rată de vaccinare mai mare decât România, a declarat dr. Mihai …

title: What Kwame Nkrumah knew about profit shifting
description: From colonial accounting tricks to modern tax havens, Nkrumah understood how capital escapes, and why political independence was never enough.

title: Strengthening health systems through NTD integration: Key insights from a multi-country webinar

title: US withdrawal from WHO threatens Africa's health gains
description: Reduced funding, weakened disease surveillance, and disruptions to health programs are likely consequences of the United States' exit from the World Health Organization. The United States sent major shockwaves through the global health system by leaving the W…

title: How does birth order influence full immunization coverage among children aged 12–23 months in India? evidence from the National Family Health Survey
description: Despite the availability of free basic vaccination programmes, the disparity continues in immunization coverage among children aged 12–23 months in India, particularly with increasing birth orders. Using the data from the NFHS 5 (2019–21), the study seeks to …

title: US withdrawal from WHO threatens Africa's health gains
description: Reduced funding, weakened disease surveillance and disruptions to health programs are likely consequences of the United States' exit from the World Health Organization.
